text: right now not really as long as you
follow good security practice updating
your system regularly you should be able
to avoid most of the ways that this can
be exploited there are two bugs meltdown
effects chips made by Intel which are in
the vast majority of computers Spectre
also effects chips found in other
devices like smartphones and tablets
everyone with a gadget that uses these
chips is potentially affected although
in reality it is businesses that are
most likely to have to worry there are
already fixes to the problem called
patches available from Microsoft and
Apple some experts say that these
patches could slow down computer
performance but it's unlikely to affect
the average user most updates will
happen automatically but it's worth
checking your settings as it will depend
what computer you have Windows 10 has
automatic updates unless you turn this
function off Apple tends to rely on
people to do their own updates the
likelihood of them being exploited by
criminals is relatively low it would
most likely be hackers acting for a
nation-state for professional hackers
that have been asked to target a
particular company
